Definitions.Definition_Content: Let $G$ be a group and $X$ a set. An action or an operation of $G$ on $X$ is a map $G \times X \longrightarrow X, \quad(g, x) \longmapsto g \cdot x$ such that: (i) $1 \cdot x=x$ for the unit element $1 \in G$ and for elements $x \in X$. (ii) $(g h) \cdot x=g \cdot(h \cdot x)$ for $g, h \in G, x \in X$.
Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a set $X$. The orbit of a point $x \in X$ is defined as $G x:=\{g x ; g \in G\}$.
Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a set $X$. The stabilizer or isotropy subgroup of a point $x \in X$ is defined as $G_{x}:=\{g \in G ; g x=x\}$.
Let $G$ be a group and $S \subset G$ a subset. The centralizer of $S$ in $G$ is given by $Z_{S}=\{x \in G ; x s=s x \text { for all } s \in S\} .$
The center of a group $G$ is defined as the centralizer of $G$, i.e., as $Z=Z_{G}=\{x \in G ; x s=s x \text { for all } s \in G\} .$
Let $G$ be a group and $S \subset G$ a subset. The normalizer of $S$ in $G$ is given by $N_{S}=\{x \in G ; x S=S x\}$.

Theorems.Theorem_Content: Let $G$ be a group and $X$ a set. Then, using the mappings $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ and $G \longrightarrow S(X)$, the group actions $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ correspond bijectively to the group homomorphisms $G \longrightarrow S(X)$.

Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a set $X$. If $x, y$ are two points of one and the same $G$-orbit in $X$, then the stabilizer subgroups $G_{x}, G_{y} \subset G$ are conjugate.
Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a set $X$. Then $X$ is the disjoint union of its G-orbits.

Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be a group action. For a point $x \in X$, the map $G \longrightarrow X, g \longmapsto g x$, induces a bijection $G / G_{x} \xrightarrow{\sim} G x$ from the set of left cosets of $G$ modulo the stabilizer subgroup $G_{x}$ onto the orbit of $x$ under $G$. In particular, we get $\operatorname{ord} G x=\operatorname{ord} G / G_{x}=(G: G_{x}) \text {. }$

Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a finite set $X$, and let $x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}$ be a system of representatives of the orbits of $X$. Then $\operatorname{ord} X=\sum_{i=1}^{n} \operatorname{ord}\left(G x_{i}\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left(G: G_{x_{i}}\right)$

Let $G$ be a finite group with center $Z$. Furthermore, consider the conjugation action on $G$ and let $x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n}$ be a system of representatives of the orbits contained in $G-Z$. Then $\operatorname{ord} G=\operatorname{ord} Z+\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left(G: Z_{\left\{x_{i}\right\}}\right)$
The group of inner automorphisms of $G$ is isomorphic to $G / Z$.
If $G / Z$ is cyclic, then $G$ is abelian.
